title: Want your family crest on a toilet seat or a wall made of sneakers? Meet the designers creating bespoke interiors for the super rich
text:
There are no limits to the lengths to which the super-rich will go in search of individuality when it comes to their homes. What about a china dinner service featuring a favourite dachshund painted by hand? No problem. Want a family crest engraved into a loo seat, or a nursery rhyme hand-carved into 17th-century wooden panelling? Ask the Oak & Rope Company.

Today, across the country, artisanal designers and makers are ­increasingly addressing the high-end whims of a clientele prepared to pay vast sums in order to have things made entirely for their own enjoyment.

Mike Fisher, the creative director of Studio Indigo, an interior design and architecture practice, has faced his fair share of ultra-bespoke...
description: There are no limits to the lengths to which the super-rich will go in search of individuality when it comes to their homes.
